author: marekm3498
content:
We've analyzed those test cases, and in the case of Nethermind, it's all about LatestValidHash. It will be less complex for us to maintain the current logic. Nonetheless, I assume that we have to pass LVH here, so we are going to fix it.

Question for CL devs: Do you think ELs should support LVH in the case of malformed `expectedBlobVersionedHashes`?

author: m.kalinin
content: Isn't `blobVersionedHashes` check similar to `blockHash` check in which a payload is self-contained and can be rejected even though the parent payload isn't available to EL? Thus, the LVH is set to `null`. Tho the spec doesn't say anything about when this check should be run, i.e. the order of checks isn't clear

author: marekm3498
content:
<@425572898787426305> - exactly. That is how Nethermind works now and we would like to stay with this logic if no problems for CLs.

We reject such invalid payload before we even check if we have a parent

author: robocopsgonemad
content: Besu does not implement this the same way as Nethermind, but it would not be difficult to adopt that approach.
